author: Alice
text: I opened an account to sell a Supreme t-shirt I had for sale. At first everything was fine, but within an hour it was taken down for the reason of being ''fake.'' I emailed customer services, asked why they thought this. It was an ''error'' made by the computer. Fair enough - so I put it back on for sale the next day. Within a couple of hours AGAIN, the t-shirt had been removed. Again, I emailed them explaining the situation. They then decided to tell me they thought it wasn't legit due to ''insufficient'' pictures. 3rd time, I make sure I post clear pictures of everything: stitching, labelling, you name it. Removed again. Very frustrated as I thought it would be perfect for selling on such a highly sought after item of clothing. I'll stick with eBay and Depop next time...
title: Confusing site to use...

author: Rob Palmer
text: Grailed knowingly and deliberately defamed me by libel and cost me a large amount of money then ignored my requests for service for weeks and denied and accountability. author: dat guy
text: Bought a item of grailed, seller corresponded well for a day, after that I was ignored and my item never got shipped. Very dissapointed as it was an expensive purchase. Frustrated and dissapointed.
title: Scammed

author: K
text: I've used grailed for over a year and their customer service is non existent. They never ban users who break rules or remove fake or joke listings. They won't even reply to questions. They removed one of my listings because "my paypal wasn't verified" in spite of the fact I'd been using it for 2 years and it was verified. You might as well just use ebay.
title: Not worth using
